segment.source: Saving, Opening, and Exporting Reports (Windows 10)
segment.target: Saving, Opening, and Exporting Reports (Windows 10)

segment.source: You can perform several common reporting tasks from the Analyze screen, including saving a compatibility report, opening a saved compatibility report (.adq) file, and exporting your report data to a spreadsheet (.xls) file.
segment.target: You can perform several common reporting tasks from the Analyze screen, including saving a compatibility report, opening a saved compatibility report (.adq) file, and exporting your report data to a spreadsheet (.xls) file.

segment.source: Saving, Opening, and Exporting Reports
segment.target: Saving, Opening, and Exporting Reports

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows 8.1
segment.target: Windows 8.1

segment.source: Windows 8
segment.target: Windows 8

segment.source: Windows 7
segment.target: Windows 7

segment.source: Windows Server 2012
segment.target: Windows Server 2012

segment.source: Windows Server 2008 R2
segment.target: Windows Server 2008 R2

segment.source: You can perform several common reporting tasks from the Analyze screen, including saving a compatibility report, opening a saved compatibility report (.adq) file, and exporting your report data to a spreadsheet (.xls) file.
segment.target: You can perform several common reporting tasks from the Analyze screen, including saving a compatibility report, opening a saved compatibility report (.adq) file, and exporting your report data to a spreadsheet (.xls) file.

segment.source: Saving Your Compatibility Report
segment.target: Saving Your Compatibility Report

segment.source: You can save your compatibility report data, including any custom filters created by the query builder tool.
segment.target: You can save your compatibility report data, including any custom filters created by the query builder tool.

segment.source: You can import this report data back into Application Compatibility Manager (ACM) at a later time.
segment.target: You can import this report data back into Application Compatibility Manager (ACM) at a later time.

segment.source: To save a report
segment.target: To save a report

segment.source: In the Quick Reports pane, click Analyze.
segment.target: In the Quick Reports pane, click Analyze.

segment.source: Expand the node for the target operating system for which you want to see compatibility reports, and then click a node for a report type.
segment.target: Expand the node for the target operating system for which you want to see compatibility reports, and then click a node for a report type.

segment.source: On the File menu, click Save As.
segment.target: On the File menu, click Save As.

segment.source: Browse to the folder where you want to save your report, and then click Save.
segment.target: Browse to the folder where you want to save your report, and then click Save.

segment.source: Opening an Existing Compatibility Report
segment.target: Opening an Existing Compatibility Report

segment.source: In ACM, you can open, or import, a compatibility report (.adq) file.
segment.target: In ACM, you can open, or import, a compatibility report (.adq) file.

segment.source: To open a report
segment.target: To open a report

segment.source: In the Quick Reports pane, click Analyze.
segment.target: In the Quick Reports pane, click Analyze.

segment.source: Expand the node for the target operating system for which you want to see compatibility reports, and then click a node for a report type.
segment.target: Expand the node for the target operating system for which you want to see compatibility reports, and then click a node for a report type.

segment.source: On the File menu, click Open Report.
segment.target: On the File menu, click Open Report.

segment.source: Browse to the folder where you saved your report, and then click Open.
segment.target: Browse to the folder where you saved your report, and then click Open.

segment.source: Exporting Compatibility Report Data
segment.target: Exporting Compatibility Report Data

segment.source: You can export your compatibility report data to an Microsoft® Excel® spreadsheet (.xls) file.
segment.target: You can export your compatibility report data to an Microsoft® Excel® spreadsheet (.xls) file.

segment.source: To export report data
segment.target: To export report data

segment.source: In the Quick Reports pane, click Analyze.
segment.target: In the Quick Reports pane, click Analyze.

segment.source: Expand the node for the target operating system for which you want to see compatibility reports, and then click a node for a report type.
segment.target: Expand the node for the target operating system for which you want to see compatibility reports, and then click a node for a report type.

segment.source: On the File menu, click Export Report.
segment.target: On the File menu, click Export Report.

segment.source: Browse to the folder where you want to store the spreadsheet file, and then click Save.
segment.target: Browse to the folder where you want to store the spreadsheet file, and then click Save.
